resources.string:
As part of your participation in the UCB Sensor Inference Study, we would like to give you a short survey that will take 1-2 minutes of your time. 


Though every daily survey is optional, these surveys greatly benefit our research and maximize your participation in our study. You can manually check for daily survey eligibility by opening our app anytime and pressing the status button. 
 Would you like to complete today's survey now?

You have submitted today's survey! 
You will be prompted for a survey on each day for the remainder of the study. 
These surveys greatly benefit our research, so you are highly encouraged to participate in each survey! 

Thank you, again, for your participation in the UC Berkeley Sensor Inference study.

To complete your participation in our research study, please complete this brief, mandatory exit survey. 
After taking the survey, you will be directed to uninstall the app.


Please note: You will not qualify for full, complete participation in this study without completion of this exit survey!

If you do not complete the very brief exit survey, you will not be considered for complete participation in the study.
\n\nAre you sure you want to skip the exit survey?

Thank you for participating in our research project! \n\n One week has passed since you installed our app, so you are officially done with your participation. You can now proceed to uninstall the app.
Consent to Participate in Research\n Understanding Smartphone Sensors

In order for you to understand your participation in this study, please read this entire disclosure:


Introduction 
This app is part of a study conducted at UC Berkeley and the International Computer Science Institute (ICSI), led by Dr. Serge Egelman, to explore the possibility of inferring user information from benign smartphone sensors, like the step counter or compass. You must be 18 years of age or older and own an Android phone running a recent version of Android.


Procedures 
This app will silently collect periodic sensor measurements: device specifications, compass, accelerometer, gyroscope, battery state, screen state, proximity (distance an object is from the screen), barometric pressure, relative humidity, ambient temperature, pedometer counts, and luminosity (how bright the environment around the phone is). It will also collect GPS data. Data collection will have minimal impact on your phone performance and battery life. Your participation in this study will involve one required introductory survey, in addition to brief daily optional surveys. These surveys will ask you about your demographics and daily activities, so that we can see if they could have been predicted based on the captured sensor data. The first survey will appear after you agree to participate in this study. Additional daily surveys will appear as notifications from this application.


Total Time Commitment 
Total active time commitment will be under 15 minutes: approximately 5 minutes to complete the initial survey, 1 minute for each daily survey, 1 minute for the exit survey, and then a week of passively keeping our app running. We will ask you to complete 6 daily surveys, at most.


Benefits / Risks 
This research will not benefit you directly. However, it will indirectly benefit you and other smartphone users by informing system designers of the data implications from benign sensors.


Some of the research questions may make you uncomfortable or upset. You are free to decline 
to answer and stop the study at any time. You may also uninstall the app at any time to stop the study.


If you find any survey content objectionable, you may choose to abstain from answering, or 
even end your participation in the study entirely. The risks for this study are minimal: these involve a potential breach of confidentiality for GPS data and other location data. We will encrypt data to decrease the probability of such a breach.


Confidentiality 
All collected data will be kept on our secure servers. The data will be maintained for possible future research. Only anonymous, non-identifiable data (i.e., not GPS) will be potentially shared with other researchers.


Rights 
Participation in research is completely voluntary. You have the right to decline to participate or to withdraw at any point in this study without penalty or loss of benefits to which you are otherwise entitled.


Contact Information 
If you have any questions or concerns about your rights and treatment as a research subject, you may contact the office of UC Berkeley's Committee for the Protection of Human Subjects, at 510-642- 7461 or subjects@berkeley.edu. Reference: CPHS# 2015-11- 8097


If you have any questions or concerns about this study, you may contact our team at: 
Sensors Inference Project Team 
sensor-inference@icsi.berkeley.edu 
https://blues.cs.berkeley.edu/sensor-inference 
International Computer Science Institute
The app will now prompt you for the following permissions:
We need this permission to collect periodic GPS data.
You will need to accept these permissions to complete your participation in this study.

You chose to deny permissions that this app needs to collect data.
 Please recall that the app will not collect any personally identifiable information besides GPS. All data that is collected will be stored securely.


Please note: You will not be considered for participation in this study with completion of this portion of the study.


The app will now close. If this is a mistake, you may restart the app and accept the permissions.
You will now be directed to complete a short survey for some demographic information needed for this research. As always, your data will be kept securely and confidentially.
Please note: You will need to answer EVERY question in the survey in order to be considered for particpation in this study.
Thank you for your participation. Your verification code is displayed below.
Please keep this code for your own reference.
This app is for a study at UC Berkeley to better understand smartphone sensors. This app will log various sensor data over the course of one week.
Computer Science Department, UC Berkeley International Computer Science Institute

You are not eligible to take today's survey at the moment. This may be because:


1. You have already submitted today's survey. You must wait until 8PM tomorrow to submit another survey. 
2. You have postponed the survey. Wait an hour before trying again. 
3. It is not yet 8PM today.


Daily surveys become available for four hours starting at 8PM every day, and can only be submitted once a day.
Recommendations for people to contact based on your message history
